ARABIC: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةً وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا صَٰلِحِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And in addition to that We gave him Ishaq and Ya'qub and made both of them salihun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And We bestowed on him Isaac, and Jacob as an additional gift, and made them righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, making each of them righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We granted him Isaac and Jacob as a gift and helped both of them to become righteous people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We bestowed him Ishaq, and Yaqub the grandson; and We made all of them worthy of Our proximity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We bestowed upon him Ishaq, and Ya`qub Nafilatan. Each one We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We gave him Ishaq and Yaqoub, a son's son, and We made (them) all good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in superfluity, and every one made We righteous
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and Jacob as a grandson. Each of them We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We bestowed Isaac and then Jacob on him as an additional boon and We made all of them righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We bestowed upon him ls-haq and Ya qub as a grandson; and each one We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And We gave him Isaac, and Jacob as well for a grandson, and each of them We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And We bestowed on him Isaac and, as an additional gift, (a grandson), Jacob, and We made righteous men of every one (of them).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We bestowed upon him Ishaque (Isaac), and (a grandson) Ya'qub (Jacob). Each one We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We gave him, in excess, Isaac, and Jacob (for a grandson); and We made each righteous
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob as a gift; and each We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:72] And We gave him, namely, Abraham — for he had asked for a child, as mentioned in [sūrat] al-Sāffāt [Q. 37:100] — Isaac, and Jacob as a gift, that is, as [something] in addition to what was requested; or it means ‘a grandson’; and each of them, that is, himself and the two born of him, We made righteous, [We made them] prophets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We bestowed upon him) i.e. upon Abraham (Isaac) as a son, (and Jacob) as a grandson. (Each of them) i.e. Abraham, Isaac, Jacob and their sons (We made righteous) in their religion, and messengers.
